journey.title: Born in Tulsa, Oklahoma
journey.description: Where the journey began

journey.title: Off to College
journey.description: 115 mile journey to the University of Arkansas

journey.title: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
journey.description: The curriculum was taught heavily based on C, C++, and Java-based programming. Other languages I learned throughout my coursework include PHP, JavaScript, SQL, HTML, and topics in computer networking.

journey.title: Director of Advertising and Public Relations
journey.description: Advise and advertise for many programs and organizations through Residents' Interhall Congress and communication to students with media.

journey.title: Public Relations Officer
journey.description: Relate about the elation of mathematics to students over social media, posters, and personal communication to University students covering special topics, social events, and the annual celebration of mind.

journey.title: Mentor Host
journey.description: This is an annual program that hosts high school students to visit the University for three days and two nights. Every student I hosted has come to the University of Arkansas.

journey.title: Summer Conference Assistant
journey.description: Develop communication skills through desk operations and creating a safe environment for camps, conferences, and other mass gatherings.

journey.title: Friday Night Live Student Coordinator
journey.description: Expand and implement the late night programming series to involve and engage the community in a safe and positive environment.

journey.title: President / Founder
journey.description: Started the first book club registered student organization at the University of Arkansas. We held biweekly meetings talking about books!

journey.title: Active Member
journey.description: As an active member of the University of Arkansas chapter, we are role models of service, bestowers of recognition, excellence of scholastics, and exercisers of leadership. Top 1% of student leaders living in residence halls.

journey.title: Summer Internship Road Trip
journey.description: 428 mile journey to Memphis area for FedEx internship

journey.title: Programmer Analyst Intern
journey.description: Worked with a team of interns to present and demonstrate a project to senior executives and directors, earning the Director's Choice, Customer Focus Award, and People's Choice Award. Participated in an agile project utilizing scrum that incorporated cross platform mobile software to send push notifications from Azure cloud for iOS, Android, and WinPhone.

journey.title: Return to Fayetteville
journey.description: Back to Arkansas for senior year and beyond

journey.title: Operating Systems / Computer Networks Grader
journey.description: Graded and facilitated discussions with fifty to seventy students. Provided feedback and progress documentation on all course work.

journey.company: U of A Bogle Academic Center
journey.title: Academic Tutor
journey.description: Tutor subjects within mathematics, computer science, computer engineering, and information system courses.

journey.title: Secretary - U of A Chapter
journey.description: Manage website, social media, and listserv of CSCE students delivering information about the latest technology, employer opportunities, and social events.

journey.title: IT and Salesman
journey.description: Managed the website, webstore, and electronic equipment at a local bicycle shop. This temporary summer job gave me an opportunity to learn about bicycles and contribute my technical skills to the local community.

journey.title: Master of Science in Computer Science
journey.description: General coursework focused on security with a research focus on IPv6 security. Courses were designed around recent research papers and held to high academic standards.

journey.title: Graduate Assistantship
journey.description: Contributed to the CSCE department by engaging with the database management course through evaluating student coursework and maintaining weekly office hours.

journey.title: Research Assistant
journey.description: NSF grant entitled Training Arkansas Computing Teachers (TACT) is an effort to train approximately 50 high school teachers to teach computer science in Arkansas high schools.

journey.title: Career Move to Kansas
journey.description: 237 mile journey north to start professional career

journey.title: Software Engineer
journey.description: Developed an application to implement meaningful use measures for reporting medical health quality across multiple organizations, involving big data wrangling, data processing, and PHI security; managed a Cloudera cluster.

journey.title: Data Analytics Teacher / TA
journey.description: Followed detailed lesson plans, supported students individually, and instructed topics involving web scraping and data analytics.

journey.title: Innovation Developer
journey.description: Work on an innovation team focused on developing prototypes and AI-driven solutions for life sciences and healthcare, involving data ingestion, transformation, and deployment within a proprietary AI platform; set up and manage AI development infrastructure, collaborate on building and deploying models, and create APIs to integrate results into business operations.

journey.title: Present Day
journey.description: You are here!
